runs.comm: swinging full ball, pushed to cover
wide length ball, driven to point
short of a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on
full, on off, driven back at him
short of a length, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on, but they are not decisive enough in going for the single
full, on off, driven back at Cusack. Ireland begin with a maiden
and Sarfraz walks down right away to cover the movement. Pushes this to cover
this one holds its line outside off, and Sarfraz lets it be
on a length, on off, he has punched this wide of mid-on. Sarfraz brings to this Pakistan batting the intent they have been missing
wide length ball, slight holding of its line. Defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, defended
short of a length, seams away a touch, defended by Shehzad
length ball, angling in, worked away for a single to long leg
length ball, angling in, defended to leg
half-volley outside off, driven sweetly, but straight to short extra cover. Story of Shehzad's batting
full, outside off, driven to the right of mid-off, gets a single to get off the mark
short of a length, seaming in, hits the inside edge on the way to the pad
too much movement back in, concedes a leg-bye
wide length ball, from wide on the crease, pushed towards cover-point
lovely take by Wilson but down leg for a wide
half-volley, angling in, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, on off, runs this down to third man
short of a length, outside off, punched sweetly but again to a fielder
finds the fielder again as he works this shortish delivery to leg
finally Shehzad finds a gap. Short and wide. Quite an ordinary delivery. He has cut this in front of point for four
wide down the leg side. They are looking to cramp him up, and are conceding some easy runs there
short of a length, angling in, defended back to him
length ball, angling in, solidly behind it in defence
full, angling in, clipped away to short midwicket
short of a length, steered away to third man for one
nice shot. On a length, outside off, driven hard into the ground, and it bounces over the cover ring for three
driven firmly but straight to mid-off
wide on the crease, length ball, angling in, defended back to him
length ball;, angling in, pushed wide of midwicket for one
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
straight length ball, beats the inside edge, Wilson doesn't collect it, and they take a bye off the ricochet off his gloves
short of a length, angling in from his wide angle, worked wide of square leg for one
full, just outside off, driven between mid-off and mid-on for a couple
full, outside off, pushed wide of mid-off for one
on a length, angling in, pushed back to him
short of a length, outside off, defended with an open face
on a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on. He has overbalanced a little. "Falling over, falling over," is the cry from behind the stumps
wide full ball, he is shaping up to sweep but sees this is too wide, and he steers it into the off side for one
second boundary. Shehzad hitting his traps finally. On a length, angling in, he drives straight of mid-on for four
short, into the body, pulled away for one
short and wide, and he has cut this in front of square for four more. This is off the toe end but he has managed to place it
leg-side half-volley, clipped away off the toes, past midwicket
on a length, into the pads, worked away for a single
wide half-volley, it takes some reaching, but he reaches it and places the drive between point and cover
full again, driven square of third man, comes back for the second
short of a length, angling in, worked around the corner for a couple
driven on the up, stylishly so, but straight to mid-off
short of a length, wide, Shehzad is forward, is in no position to play, rolls his wrists on it, gets an edge wide of slip
length ball, angling in, worked away fine of fine leg
short of a length, outside off, pushed to mid-off
short of a length, stops at him, he ends up playing it to short cover
swept away first ball. Sarfraz can sweep you to distraction. He is Moin Khan incarnate when sweeping. Gets four to square leg
long hop. That's what a sweep does to you. You lose your length. Pulled away between mid-on and midwicket
makes room, pushes this length ball wide of cover for one
tossed up outside off, driven on the up, straight to short cover
short and wide. Poor over from Dockrell. He has cut this for four easy runs
lovely shot. Down the wicket to take this on the full, and then wrists it between mid-on and midwicket for four
full, low full toss, driven straight to short midwicket
that wide slip hasn't gone for it. This is full, wide and swinging, takes the edge but the wide slip doesn't react as this goes slowly to his left. Perhaps the keeper standing up has blindsighted him
punched down the ground, between mid-on and mid-off for three
short of a length, angling in, punched to mid-on
low dipping full toss, kept out
length ball, angling in, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, wide, punched away past point
short of a length, angling in, defended to mid-on
short of a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on again
full, angled in, pushed wide of mid-on
short of a length, outside off, defended
flicked away from around off, but can't beat midwicket
punched away on the up, straight to that man at short mid-on, but on the half-volley
wide length ball, driven on the up, between cover-point and cover, come back for three
short of a length, angling in, worked to leg
short of a length, on off, punched powerfully, but straight to cover
full, angling in, slower ball, pushed to that short mid-on again. On the bounce, though
lovely cover-drive on the up, pierces it through that busy cover ring, gets two runs for it
on a length, on off, defended back to him
short of a length, just outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, looks to pull it, mis-times it to mid-on
lovely punch on the run, between mid-on and midwicket. They take three runs
full, outside off, pushed to mid-off
leg-side half-volley, and he has flicked this between mid-on and midwicket for three more
short of a length, on off, runs this down to third man for one
slower ball, just outside off, defended
short of a length, wide, opens the face late, gets a single to third man
short of a length, angling in, lazy push by Shehzad, gets a single off the inside edge
short and wide, cut away to third man for one
steers this down to third man for a single
full and straight, pushed back to O'Brien
wide length ball, driven square for a single to third man
bouncer with the keeper up. That's not very generous on Wilson. Sarfraz bails out of this ramp at the last moment

dropped him. A little legcutter from O'Brien. Short of a length, moves away, takes the edge, goes straight into Wilson's gloves but doesn't settle there. Biggish deflection so not quite an easy chance
angling in, worked fine of fine leg
length ball, on the pads, worked away to fine leg for one
short of a length, angling in, worked away to leg
half-volley outside leg, clipped away for a single that brings up his fifty in a crucial chase
short of a length, looks to punch this, is beaten
full, angling in, pushed to that short mid-on
full, outside off, driven to mid-off this time
short of a length, angling in, he opens the face late, takes a single to third man
looks to ramp this short ball towards third man, but is beaten
on a length, just outside off, opens the face, can't beat point
puled away in the air, agonisingly wide of short midwicket. Agonising for Ireland, that is
short of a length, drops this n front of point and takes a single. This is what didn't happen in Sarfraz's absence
bouncer, pretty sharp, just outside off, left alone
on a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on
wide length ball, pushed to deep cover for one that brings up the 100-run stand. Great news for Pakistan
short and wide, but cut away straight to point
length ball, angling in, moves inside the line to work this for one
short of a length, on off, worked to square leg for one
short of a length, angling in, worked away for a single to square leg
wide half-volley, squeezed out in front of third man for a couple
moves his back foot across, O'brien bowls the bouncer, outside off, left alone
short and wide, and cut away in front of point. Deep cover Mooney misfields, and allows three extra runs
on a length, just outside off, a legcutter. Defended from the crease
slower ball again, on off, defended from the crease
pulled away in front of square. Rolls his wrists to keep it down
slower legcutter, steers this down to third man to bring up his fifty. What an addition he has been to this XI
short of a length, just outside off, punched to point
short of a length, just outside off, defended to point
driven on the up, but straight to mid-on
short of a length, looks to run this down to third man, but the ball skids off and beats him for pace
short and wide, deliberately bunted over point for three
short of a length, into the pads, tucked away for a single
short of a length, wide, punched on the up, but can't beat point
bouncer, just outside off, sways out of its line
on a length, outside off, defended to cover
pulled away to deep midwicket for one
slower ball, driven uppishly, on the first bounce to mid-off
pulled down, to short midwicket
driven on the up, but straight to mid-off
mid-on is up, he takes him on by charging at him and chipping this shortish ball over mid-on
driven hard back at him, and he fields well in the follow-through

and Shehzad has thrown it away. Seems like he has made his mind beforehand that this ball has to go. Thompson bowls short, he pulls from outside off, gets a top edge, and mid-on catches it. He is disappointed that he has not gone on to score a hundred, and so he should be
full, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on
short of a length, angling in, he works it wide of deep midwicket to get off the mark with a couple
full ball, driven to long-on for one
full, outside off, no turn, defended back to him
down the wicket, too close to the pitch of the ball, defended back to him
flatter, he goes back to punch it, but finds short straight cover
leaves hi crease, he is beaten in the flight by the dipping offbreak. Hit on the pad
no turn, pitched up outside off, pushed off the inside half of the bat back to Stirling
length ball, middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
short of a length, punched down to long-no for one

Sarfraz has run Sohail out. That's what Solhail lets Sarfraz know. This is short of a length, has been turned around the corner, towards short fine leg, both start running before Sarfraz stops midway. No time left for Sohail to get back. He seems to be telling Sarfraz, "Mera call tha" [It was my call] before departing. And he is right as this has gone behind square
tossed up on off, driven to long-off for one
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
defended off the front foot
on a length, angling in, clipped wide of midwicket for a couple
short, down the leg side, but not called wide as it has moved away after passing the stumps
short of a length, on off, dropped into the off side for a single
short of a length, angling in, worked to leg for a single

half-volley outside off with no mid-off. Pushed away through that region for easy runs. That gap has presented itself because of his earlier shot through midwicket, which means an extra fielder on the leg side. Sarf has earned this runs
more uncertain calling. This is pushed to the right of square leg. Misbah wants one, Sarfraz sends him back. But then a misfield lets them take a the single
tossed up on off, no turn, pushed back to Stirling
pushed to long-off for a single
some dip on this one, forces a front-foot defensive from Sarfraz
fired down the leg side for a wide. Oh not called. The umpire reckons there is pad involved
more uncertain running. This time it is Misbah who has turned down an easy single to the right of point
and they get one this time after hitting straight to point. Unnecessary throw, and they get an overthrow
again no mid-off. And he has punched this length ball through that gap for three more
front-foot defensive as he pitches outside off
wide length ball, defended off the front foot
bouncer, middle and leg, he ducks under it
on a length, on off, plays a clip on the run, straight to midwicket
wide length ball, defended off the front foot
flighted on off, driven to long-on for one
short, wide, he rocks back to punch this past point for two
tuk tuk tuk tuk tuk tuk bang without no inclination or reason. Full ball, middle and leg, and for some reason Misbah goes over mid-on for four
flighted outside off, defended off the front foot
another forward-defensive
low full toss, driven to the left of short mid-off for one
short ball, he is early into the pull, at 125ks this comes off slowly. Bottom-edged into the body. Gets a single
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for a single to leg
length ball, into the pads, defended to midwicket
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
short again, this time Misbah waits for it, and pulls this to deep midwicket
bouncer, too high, easy call on that wide
walks down the wicket to work this shortish delivery fine of fine leg for a couple
stays back a flat delivery, and defends
and again without any trigger Misbah goes boom. Gets under a length ball, and slog-sweeps this over mid-on for six
reverse-sweeps this for single straight of short third man
tossed up outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
flat, angling in, defended to leg
he shows his the reverse shot, sees Dockrell has fired this in, and plays the regulation sweep for a single
length ball, angling in, beats his inside edge, but is headed down leg
pulled away to long leg for one
flicked on the run again, just wide enough of that short midwicket
length ball outside off, defended with an open face
short of a length, angling in, worked to leg for one
wide length ball, pushed wide of mid-off for one
full, outside off, pushed to mid-off
wides down the leg side with the keeper up
wide half-volley, pushed to cover
on a length, angling in, defended to midwicket
wide on the crease, as usual, Misbah defends a length ball to mid-on
wide half-volley, Misbah reaches out, opens the face, gets it past point, four runs for the taking
short of a length, angling in, played to short midwicket
short ball, pulled away for one
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, outside off, runs this past slip for one
bouncer, just outside off, lets it be
slower ball, short, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
sharp quick bouncer, Misbah pulls out of the pull at the last moment
good ball. From wide on the crease it swings away against the angle. Beats Sarfraz's drive
angling in again, defended to leg
driven on the up, but straight to mid-on
short of a length, holds its line, beats his attempt at a dab
short of a length, outside off, pushed on the up, but straight to point
punched down to mid-on. That's a rare maiden
straight length ball, defended to leg
short of a length, outside off, steers this down to third man for one
short, gentle pace, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
bouncer, pretty sharp, he sways out of its line. Called wide on height
short of a length, outside off, defended to point
punched away to point
full toss, middle and leg, pulled away for an easy six
looks to sweep this, gets a bouncer, he still swings, and is beaten
slower bouncer, Sarfraz early into the shot. Beaten
short of a length, outside off, runs this down in front of third man for a couple
this time he cuts this between point and cover-point, with just about enough timing to beat the chase
and he is cutting them to pieces now. Short and wide, he gets under it, and cuts it over point. Mooney chases and dives from third man, but can't keep it in
pushed to mid-on with soft hands, and calls him through for a quick single
short of a length, pretty tight, punched back to him
short, not advisable at that pace, pulled wide of deep midwicket for a couple to move into the 90s
on a length, just outside off, defended to cover
slower short ball gone wrong. Big wide down the leg side
length ball, angling in, worked away for a single
short and wide, whips away a cut there for four. That has scorched past point
pulled away to long leg. He will keep the strike
on a length, on off, defended off the back foot
bouncer, down leg too, called wide

bowled'im. Some consolation for Ireland. Looks to run this shortish ball to third man, but his bat is neither vertical nor horizontal. The back foot goes back and across, too close to the stumps, and he treats onto the base of the stumps
bouncer, just outside off, he sways out of its line
on a length, outside off, pushed to cover
defended from the crease as this is pitched on a length, just outside off
short of a length, wide, punched to cover
short, not good at that pace, chest high, pulled away for a couple
short of a length, pushed to mid-on
full outside off, squeezed out
driven to mid-on, he starts running before sending him back. Not very decisive in his calls
wide length ball, driven straight to cover-point
wide length ball, pushed to cover
no mid-on in place so Akmal goes ahead and pulls this wide short ball through that gap for four
placed wide of mid-on for one
short, pulled away to deep square leg for a single
lovely shot. This is short of a length, Akmal goes deep into the crease to pull this with a vertical bat through midwicket for four
high short ball, pulled to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, on off, defended back to him
length ball, outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, angling in, defended to midwicket
slower bouncer, pulled away for a single
wide down the leg side
short of a length, pushed back down the ground, into the stumps at the non-striker's end
pushed to mid-on. Another over ends
length ball, angling in, defended
slower legcutter, punched down to mid-on
he has had enough of the blocking, and lofts a length ball over mid-on. Sarf now needs six out of 11. Getting tight
slower legcutter, defended from the crease
another legcutter, defended dutifully by Akmal
defended off the front foot. Sarfraz gets strike
swept away to long leg but Akmal is watching the ball. He doesn't even look at Sarfraz who wants the seocnd
pushes a length ball straight to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, left alone
wide down the leg side. Short of a length, down the leg side, it has gone under the armpit, Ireland are appealing, but is called a wide. Boo
length ball, into the pads, worked away for a single
slower ball, steers it down to third man. He won't mind the single. Akmal will block the next ball
short of a length, on off, Akmal does right by Sarfraz and defends this
and he has bowled a wide. Oh my, just down the leg side, from wide on the crease
chipped down to long-on for one
full toss, Akmal suppresses every urge to defend
wide on the crease, angling in, defended to leg
full, on off, defended
slower ball, at the stumps, defended again
short of a length, outside off, he is lucky this is wide but not wide enough. Left alone
full toss, he has hit it down to long-on, and he has turned down a single

there it is. Sarfraz gets the hard-earned hundred. And with a typical shot. Down the wicket to chip this length ball over midwicket. Does the sajda in celebration. The first WC hundred by a Pakistani since Imran Nazir in 2007
low full toss, hit straight to mid-off
flat length ball, into the pads, defended to midwicket
full toss, defended back to him. There could be a tie here
full, on off, defended
he tries a legbreak, bowls it short and wide, and Akmal launches it over mid-on to seal the quarter-final slot
